request_pathways.name: Authorization to Disclose Protected Health Information

forms.document_type: ROI authorization form (wrong organization — UC Health Cincinnati)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: A system-wide authorization form with an explicit 'If released to self' section offering email, patient portal, mail, and PowerShare delivery, plus a separate MRO Express online portal.

red_flags: No submission instructions on the form itself — no address, fax number, or email for where to send the completed authorization
Outdated forms (2017, 2018) remain publicly hosted with no indication they are superseded
bright_spots: Explicit patient vs. third-party fee separation: free via portal, free paper up to 100 pages for patients
Post-Dobbs reproductive healthcare warning alerting patients to litigation risks
Granular sensitive-category consent (HIV/AIDS, mental health, substance abuse, genetic, reproductive health, sickle cell) with separate signature line
Visit record vs. Visit summary definitions help patients understand what they are requesting
MRN moved to office-use-only section, removing a barrier for patients who don't know their medical record number

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with basic navigation — the current form is linked directly from a well-organized medical records page reachable in 1–2 clicks, though orphaned older versions and domain confusion with UC Health Cincinnati create minor hazards.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital with one gap — the org offers an MRO Express online portal for fully digital submission and fax is available, but the primary PDF form has zero fillable fields, requiring print-and-handwrite.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with minor issues — logical top-to-bottom flow, plain language, helpful record-type definitions, but extremely dense single-page layout and no submission instructions on the form itself.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 4: Patient access is clearly accommodated within a multi-purpose form — explicit 'If released to self' section with four delivery options, separate patient fee schedule (free), and MRO Express portal, though no dedicated patient-only access form exists.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities but nothing material — free patient access, clear rights statements, no unnecessary barriers, reproductive healthcare warning; however, no processing time commitment is stated and the '100+ pages sent electronically' policy is ambiguous.

overall.summary: UCHealth provides a well-organized, easy-to-find authorization form that clearly accommodates patient self-access with free delivery options and strong compliance, but the non-fillable PDF format and missing submission instructions prevent a top-tier rating.
